alert.note: Alert for Humacao; Maunabo; Naguabo; Patillas; Yabucoa (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 18 at 10:21AM ADT until September 18 at 2:15PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Humacao County in Puerto Rico... Maunabo County in Puerto Rico... Naguabo County in Puerto Rico... Patillas County in Puerto Rico... Yabucoa County in Puerto Rico... * Until 115 PM AST. * At 921 AM AST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Significant additional rainfall is expected, of at least 3 to 6 inches in the next several hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Yabucoa, Humacao, Maunabo, Patillas, Naguabo, Emajagua, Martorell, La Fermina, Anton Ruiz, Playita, Punta Santiago, Palmas, Aguas Claras, Roosevelt Roads, Comunas, Candelero Arriba, Rosa Sanchez, El Negro, Bajandas and Palo Seco. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
